page.title: 08 Godspeed (contd)
page.content: The colony survived and settled in what is now Jamestown in Virginia. So it is not, as is generally believed, true that the American nation had its roots with the Pilgrim Fathers, a group of devout refugees fleeing religious and political persecution in 1620. Rather it began with a group of farmers and tradesmen from Norfolk and Suffolk. In 1985 the voyage of re-enactment began. The current Godspeed is only 68 ft long. At the waterline she is 48ft with a beam of 14ft8ins, hardly room for the 40-50 people who would have sailed in the original ship. After encountering a few problems en- route, mainly with weather conditions, the Godspeed safely achieved its objective. Proving without doubt that such a voyage was indeed possible.
